questions.text: What was the title character's name?
questions.explanation:
Jim Morris.

	Jim Morris pitched a total of 15 innings in 21 appearances for his two years in the Major Leagues. He had no wins, losses or saves in any of his games and ended his career with an ERA of 4.80.

questions.text: What Texas city did the most of the movie take place in?
questions.explanation:
Big Lake, Texas.

	Jim Morrison was born on January 19, 1964 in Brownwood, Texas and moved around quite often due to his father's career in the military before finally settling in Big Lake.  Even though the movie calls the school where Jim teaches and coaches at as Big Lake High School, in reality, it's call Reagan Co. High School.In some of the actual high school games, the team would score 30 runs but the producers of the movie did not want to include that fact and show the games as being close for dramatic effect.  People credit the turn around in their success to facing Jim Morris in batting practice because he did not realize he was throwing the ball up to the plate at 90+ MPH.

questions.text: Who played Jim Morris as a boy?
questions.explanation:
Trevor Morgan.

	Trevor Morgan played the role of young Jimmy although he was uncredited for it.  Other movies that Trevor Morgan has appeared in are "The Patriot", "Jurassic Park III", and "The Sixth Sense".  Since Trevor is right handed he had to learn to throw the ball left handed to simulated Jim Morris.

questions.text: What actor played the role of Jim's father?
questions.explanation:
Brian Cox.

	Brian Cox was the first actor to portray the character of Dr. Hannibal Lector in the 1986 movie "Manhunter".

questions.text: What was the nickname of the player Joaquin Campos?
questions.explanation:
Wack.

	Wack was his nickname and he was played by Jay Hernandez.

questions.text: The scene where Jim Morris stops by the side of the road and throws the ball past the radar actually happened.
questions.explanation:
False.

	That scene was added for dramatic effect. The film was not filmed in west Texas but in Throndale Texas which is Northeast of Austin.

questions.text: Finish this quote that was said by Jim's wife Lorri: "Jim Morris, I'm a _________ woman, which means I have no need for a man to keep things running."
questions.explanation:
Texas.

	Lorri was played by Rachel Griffiths whose other credits include "Hillary and Jackie", "Blow" and "Muriel's Wedding".

questions.text: For which team was Jim Morris playing before being called up by the Tampa Bay Devil Rays?
questions.explanation:
Durham Bulls.

	He was playing for the Durham Bulls, which were the inspiration for the movie "Bull Durham".  The stadium that was used for scenes shot for the minors was Dell Diamond in Round Rock, Texas, home of the Round Rock Express which is co-owned by Hall of Famer Nolan Ryan.

questions.text: Which of the following was an error that was made in the movie?
questions.correct: Jim Morris runs out of the wrong bullpen
options: His first game was not against the Rangers
The actual game was a day game and not a night game
He actually walked the first batter he faced
questions.explanation:
Jim Morris runs out of the wrong bullpen.

	On September 9, 1999, Jim Morris made his debut in a night game at The Ballpark in Arlington where he struck out Royce Clayton.  Therefore, the error is that he ran out of the wrong bullpen.  They show him running out of the bullpen in right field but the visitor's bullpen at The Ballpark in Arlington is actually in left field. Also, the scenes in which they show him in the bullpen talking to his wife would have been the Ranger's bullpen also. Another error was when they show the cab driving up to bring him to The Ballpark in Arlington - it was driving on the wrong side of the road.  A couple of other errors are Gabe Kapler batting for the Rangers even though he wouldn't become a Ranger until the 2000 season and the Rangers wore blue uniforms instead of the red ones they wore in 1999.

questions.text: The first batter that faced Jim Morris in his first Major League game was Royce Clayton.  What was the outcome of that at bat?
questions.explanation:
Strikeout.

	In Jim Morris's first appearance, he struck out Royce Clayton at The Ballpark in Arlington.
